docs.snippet: President Trump issued an order prohibiting Broadcom, a Singapore-based chip maker, from purchasing Qualcomm, citing a threat to the national security of the United States.

headline.print_headline: Trump Blocks Overseas Takeover of Qualcomm
headline.main: Trump Blocks Broadcom’s Bid for Qualcomm

docs.snippet: “We had a very good call,” President Trump told reporters in the Oval Office after speaking with the Russian leader after his re-election. “We will probably be meeting in the not-too-distant future.”

headline.print_headline: President’s Call To Putin Dodges Talk of Foul Play

docs.snippet: The White House said Tuesday night that President Trump plans to deploy the National Guard to confront what it called a growing threat of illegal immigrants, drugs and crime from Central America.

headline.print_headline: Trump Foresees  National Guard  Securing Border
headline.main: Trump Plans to Send National Guard to the Mexican Border

docs.snippet: A few Republicans have suggested that the dismissal of Robert S. Mueller III as special counsel could lead to President Trump’s impeachment, but it is unclear how.

headline.print_headline: Daunting Obstacles Stand In Path to Impeachment, Even if Mueller Is Fired
headline.main: Even Republicans Have Used the ‘I’ Word, but Would Firing Mueller Get Trump Impeached?

docs.snippet: The conservative author says that Donald Trump is in danger of losing his most loyal supporters, including her, if he doesn’t build the wall.

headline.main: Ann Coulter Says President Trump Is ‘Failing’

docs.snippet: President Trump’s declaration, after days of silence on gun control, came in response to an Op-Ed by the retired Supreme Court Justice John Paul Stevens.

headline.main: Trump Says Second Amendment ‘Will Never Be Repealed’

docs.snippet: The lawyer, Joseph E. diGenova, will serve as an aggressive player on the president’s legal team.
